description.en: Students enter the subject with your own idea or concept design. The principles of design thinking and service design are introduced and the opportunity to apply them is given. The subject teaches students to develop your ideas using creative thinking techniques and design thinking principles. During the course, the original idea becomes a developed and structured idea, which is thoroughly thought out and presented to others. In addition, students learn to present their ideas convincingly
description.et: Ainesse sisenetakse oma ideega või ideekavandiga.  Tutvustatakse disainmõtlemise ning teenusdisaini põhimõtteid ning antakse võimalus nende rakendamiseks. Aine õpetab oma ideed arendama kasutades loovmõtlemise tehnikaid ning disaimõtlemise printsiipe. Aine jooksul saab algsest ideest arendatud ning struktureeritud idee, mis on igakülgselt läbi mõeldud ning ka teistele esitletud.  Lisaks õpitakse oma ideid veenvalt esitlema

objectives.en: The purpose of the subject is to give the participant an in-depth understanding of the idea development process and techniques. The subject develops creative problem-solving skills and introduces various tools for idea generation and development.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärk on anda osalejale süvitsi minev arusaam ideede arendamise protsessist ning tehnikatest. Aine arendab  loovat probleemilahendamise oskust ning tutvustab ideede genereerimise ning arendamise erinevaid tööriistu.

learning_outcomes.en: The student: *has an overview of the concepts of idea development and applies them in the context of design thinking; *uses creative thinking techniques for problem solving and knows how to generate ideas; *applies creative thinking in solving practical problems and finds innovative solutions; * can present his/her/their ideas convincingly
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane: *omab ülevaadet ideede arendamise kontseptsioonidest ja rakendab neid disainmõtlemise kontekstis; *kasutab probleemilahendusel loova mõtlemise tehnikaid ja valdab ideede genereeerimise võtteid; *rakendab loovat mõtlemist praktiliste probleemide lahendamisel ning leiab selleks innovatiivseid lahendusi; * oskab oma ideid veenvalt esitleda

notes.et: Aine õppejõud ja läbiviijad on Külliki Tafel-Viia ja Markko Karu.

topic.et: Foundations of Ideation and Design Thinking

description.et:
16.00-17.30 Külliki Tafel-Viia

This lecture introduces creativity as an industry, presenting a systematic approach to ideation and design thinking. It traces the evolution of design from traditional crafts to modern practices of co-creation, and provides an overview of the double diamond design methodology. We dive into the history and evolution of design thinking, its role in fostering innovation, and fundamental principles, with case studies from different companies like IDEO and Apple and examples of design thinking across various sectors, including business, technology, healthcare, and social innovation.

Slaidid leitavad siit: https://docsend.com/view/eavp9tkfwsupii4i
IDEO Shopping Cart Project: https://youtu.be/W6EgoiPxNDs?feature=shared

topic.et: Innovation, User Empathy and Problem Framing

description.et:
16.00-17.30; 18.00 - 19.30 Markko Karu 

This lecture explores how innovation drives progress across industries and positions design as a problem-solving discipline that defines problems, generates solutions, and prototypes them. A key element is user empathy, achieved through research and observation, using tools such as personas and empathy mapping.

The session also covers techniques for framing and reframing problems, such as “How Might We” questions and problem reversal. The assignment involves creating a problem statement for a chosen challenge.

Slides: https://docsend.com/view/zwckqkivmubwda2t

14.30-16.00 Markko Karu

We will be discussing  various limitations to creativity, including cultural, sensory, and environmental factors, and explore how ideation works through analysis and synthesis. The session emphasizes finding external and internal sources of inspiration and offers techniques for overcoming creative blocks, such as mindfulness and embracing constraints. Participants will collect inspiration for an ideation session.

Slides: https://docsend.com/view/5nz8cdf2czhj2xpv

18.00-19.30 Markko Karu

This session delves into creative thinking techniques such as brainstorming, brainwriting, mind mapping, and SCAMPER. A workshop will guide participants in defining challenging questions and conducting an ideation session to generate solutions.

Slides: https://docsend.com/view/wf2sttcg8wzrb5af

18.00-19.30 Külliki Tafel-Viia

This lecture examines the impact of global trends on the service economy, the challenges of operating in a VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) world, and the role of megatrends in shaping the future. The session also introduces forecasting techniques and future scenarios, with resources provided for further study.

Slides: https://docsend.com/view/yskuaz4u4y52zdsb

topic.et: Working with ideas in a team

description.et:
10.30-12.00 Markko Karu

This session focuses on selecting, merging, and validating ideas within a team. Participants will learn to give feedback, collaborate effectively, and prioritize ideas by aligning them with user needs.

Slides, https://docsend.com/view/huersspa6fn98nn4

16.00-17.30 Markko Karu

The session covers prototyping techniques, including paper prototypes and digital tools, and explores the importance of iteration in the design process. Participants will receive instructions on how to prepare for a final presentation.

Slides, https://docsend.com/view/zk769ifwubfxe84h

16.00-17.30; 18.00-19.30 Külliki Tafel-Viia

Participants will learn to conduct user testing, gather feedback, and iterate on their designs. The session includes different methods on how to gather feedback, choose test-groups, learn how to understand the saturation of information.

Slides: https://docsend.com/view/m4k3iscjbiay7aqa
